question:
The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don’t find any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer.
As they driven through the dark, twisting lane / down which they had walked earlier, Lucius heard / the whistling of the night air in his ears.

(SSC MTS 2023 : 11_Sept_Shift-1)
option_1: the whistling of the night air in his ears.
option_2: down which they had walked earlier, Lucius heard
option_4: As they driven through the dark, twisting lane
solution:
Answer: (4) As they driven through the dark, twisting lane
Solution:
• The phrase "As they driven" is incorrect because "driven" is a past participle and cannot stand alone without an auxiliary verb.
• The correct form should be "As they were driving" or "As they drove."
• The other parts of the sentence are grammatically correct.
• Therefore, the error is in part (4).

question:
Parts of the following sentence have been given as options. Select the option that contains an error.
You shall repented tomorrow for your misdeeds.

(SSC MTS 2023 : 11_Sept_Shift-3)
solution:
Answer: (3) shall repented
Solution:
• The modal verb "shall" should be followed by the base form of the verb, not the past participle.
• The correct phrase is "shall repent" instead of "shall repented."
• Other parts (You, tomorrow, for your misdeeds) are correct.
• Therefore, segment (3) contains the error.

question:
The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them contains an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options.
He was / late / for school / and punished.

(SSC CGL 2021 T-1 : 12 Apr S1 (9 to 10 AM))
solution:
Explanation:

Part: “and punished” ❌

This part is grammatically incorrect because it is missing a helping verb to match the passive construction.

  • The sentence says "He was late" (past tense + adjective), and the next part "and punished" needs a verb that matches the first clause.

  • ✅ Correct passive form:
    → "and was punished"

You cannot join “was late” and “punished” directly without repeating the helping verb "was" before "punished" unless the second verb is active and parallel (e.g. “He ran fast and fell down”).

📝 Correct Sentence:

He was late for school and was punished.

✅ Final Answer: and punished

question:
Parts of the following sentence have been given as options. Select the option that contains an error.
Yesterday, I went to the store and buy some groceries.

(SSC Steno 2023 : 12 Oct Shift-1 (9_00 to 11_00 AM))
solution:
The option that contains the error is: buy some groceries

The given sentence is in Past tense. So, second form of verb should be use here.

Therefore, “bought” should be come in place of “buy”.

The corrected sentence is: "It takes me an hour to get to work at the moment, but when the new road is finished, it will be much quicker."
